'Abietic acid' (also known as abietinic acid or sylvic acid) is an organic
compound that occurs widely in trees. It is the primary component of resin acid,
is the primary irritant in pine wood and resin, isolated from rosin (via
isomerization) and is the most abundant of several closely related organic acids
that constitute most of rosin, the solid portion of the oleoresin of coniferous
trees. Its ester is called an abietate. Lars-Hugo Norlin "Tall
Oil" in Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry 2002, Wiley-VCH,
Weinheim.
